page.title: 18BUILDINGS HEDLEY FELL AREA
page.content: {BIRKHEAD COTTAGES}situated 2km.S.E.of Marley Hill these stone cottages were built by the Bowes Railway Company for their railway workers.The railway is now dismantled and the cottages are quite remote,sometimes being blocked in during Winter.They are now owned by people who enjoy peace and natural surroundings.They travel to nearby towns to work,shop and go to school. Some work at home.A baker calls twice a week and a fishmonger comes once. {BRIAR DENE }boarding kennels 1.5km. from Kibblesworth Grange Farm. Most of the buildings in the Marley Hill,Hedley Fell and Causey area are built of stone and over a hundred years old.There has been very little new building.Apart from the buildings near main roads there is no mains gas or sewerage.Old Ravensworth Farm does not even have a septic tank.
